item.title: Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition now available for Switch 2, Switch
item.content:encoded:
• Switch
  • Switch 2

2013 reboot shadow drops on Nintendo platforms.

Publisher Aspyr and developer Crystal Dynamics have released Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition for Switch 2 and Switch via Nintendo eShop, the companies announced. It is currently available at a 10 percent-off launch discount price of $17.99 until November 24, after which it will cost $19.99.

A remastered version of the 2013-released Tomb Raider reboot, Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition first launched for PlayStation 4 and Xbox One on January 82, 2014, followed by PC on April 14, 2024.

Here is an overview of the Switch 2 and Switch versions, via Aspyr:

The Definitive Edition of the critically acclaimed action-adventure, now available on Nintendo Switch and Nintendo Switch 2!

The cinematic action-adventure that forced Lara Croft to grow from an inexperienced young woman into a hardened survivor has been re-built for next-gen consoles, featuring an obsessively detailed Lara and a stunningly lifelike world. Lara must endure high-octane combat, customize her weapons and gear, and overcome grueling environments to survive her first adventure and uncover the islandâ€™s deadly secret.
